title: 2 Simple Ways to Convert Excel Data to PowerPoint + Why

steps.title: Open an Excel file.
steps.content: Open an Excel file. You can use copy and paste to put an Excel chart, graph, or other data into a PowerPoint presentation.

steps.title: Select the data you want to use.
steps.content: Select the data you want to use. You can click the box in the top-left corner of the data to select everything. If you only want to select a certain chart or graph , click and drag one corner to the other.

steps.title: Press Ctrl+C (Windows) or ⌘ Cmd+C (Mac) to copy.
steps.content: Press Ctrl + C (Windows) or ⌘ Cmd + C (Mac) to copy. Alternatively, right-click or control-click the chart and select Copy .

steps.title: Open your Microsoft PowerPoint presentation.
steps.content: Open your Microsoft PowerPoint presentation. Navigate to the slide where you want to paste the Excel data.

steps.title: Press Ctrl+V (Windows) or ⌘ Cmd+V (Mac) to paste.
steps.content: Press Ctrl + V (Windows) or ⌘ Cmd + V (Mac) to paste. Alternatively, right-click or control-click where you want the chart and select Paste . For more paste options, click the Home tab and click the arrow underneath the Paste icon. You can select: Keep Source Formatting , Use Destination Styles , Link & Keep Source Formatting , Link & Use Destination Styles , Picture , or Keep Text Only .

steps.title: Edit the Excel data on the slide.
steps.content: Edit the Excel data on the slide. To move the chart or graph, click the outer edge and drag it to a new location. To resize it, drag the corner circle inwards to make it smaller or drag it outwards to make it bigger.

steps.title: Customize the chart (optional).
steps.content: Customize the chart (optional). If you want to edit the data or change its layout elements, styles, and filters, do the following: Select the chart. Click the Chart/Table Design or Chart/Table Tools Design tab. Click Data . Click Edit Data . Select a modification option.

steps.title: Open your PowerPoint file.
steps.content: Open your PowerPoint file. You can use the Object tool to link Excel data in PowerPoint if you don't want to copy and paste it. This tool will insert the Excel file into your presentation so that when you update the data in Excel, it will also update in the presentation.

steps.title: Click Insert.
steps.content: Click Insert . This is in the top toolbar.

steps.title: Select Object.
steps.content: Select Object . You can find this in the Text section.

steps.title: Select Create from file.
steps.content: Select Create from file . This is the button on the left.

steps.title: Click Browse.
steps.content: Click Browse . This is underneath the File field.

steps.title: Select your Excel file.
steps.content: Select your Excel file. Use the pop-up File Explorer to find and select your file. Then, click Open or Insert .

steps.title: Click OK.
steps.content: Click OK . This is at the bottom-right corner of the window. The Excel file will be linked to your PowerPoint. If you change the data in Excel, you'll need to refresh the presentation to stay up-to-date. Right-click the data in PowerPoint and select Update Link . steps.title: Better visuals.
steps.content: Better visuals. If you have a lot of data to show in your presentation, converting your Excel data allows you to customize its appearance to make it easier for your audience to digest.

steps.title: Professional look.
steps.content: Professional look. Polished and organized charts can show you have authority over your data and are confident in it.

steps.title: Structured presentations.
steps.content: Structured presentations. If your work consists of presenting a lot of data, converting Excel into PowerPoint can help organize and separate your charts and graphs into manageable sections.
